Undead Caster

Fiona is one of a few casters who has mastered the deathless arts, she is total epic, her adventures are everlast for her goal is to simply "always get better" at what she does.

This char is designed mostly as a wizard with nice immunities (to criticals, for example) and some combat skills. Yes with weapon finesse and her nice dexterity she can deal with lesser monsters to save her spells for the bosses. This char is playable for the most part of the game as a wizard, but her full power comes with her last level as a  monk.

Well this build can do most things as she is very versatile. She can be at the rear as a supporting caster, or near the front lines unleashing hravoc. Due to her high AC she can deal with lesser monsters and thus save her power spells for the bosses. In PvP a time stop spell comes in the first place, after that 3 maximized IMS can do a lot of damage and kill many things, add up Horrid Wilting, etc.

When it comes to fight she can use Mestil Acid Sheath, Shadow Shield or the Bigbi's Hands. It is very handy to use Extended Expeditious Retreat in advance. Her level as Monk gives her a nice Evasion Feat, due to her nice dexterity and Weapon Finesse she can fight with lesser monsters as stated above. Her Epic Spell Focus in Necromancy makes her Wail of the Banshee hard to resist.

This is a rather easy to play char, she is very funny and when nothing works out, she can persuade before killing everyone in sight

Well, that's all folks

Regards

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Welcome to the guild, rauzer

You really brought me back in time with this format, but i can understand it just fine, so let's get to the build itself.

Here we have an undead caster as you say that thrives by making people hit his damage shields and kill themselves due to the insane backlash damage. You are also have some nice feats over there, both thematic and potent, like ESF: Necromancy/ ES: Penetration. Probably in tough times you also make use of the Iron Golem Shape while you are encased in your colorful damage sheilds. All of these tactics are well and good but i have to question some things you have done here. Why do you raise both your Dexterity and your Intelligence instead of only the last one? Is that so you can get a couple more points of AC? You don't have Uncanny Dodge so the Dexterity-based AC you have is not secure by any means and even if it were, it is just plain better to have more Intelligence that is your main stat and the source of your power. Leave your Dexterity at 14 and use those points in order to get your Intelligence higher and then your ESF in Necromancy will be really potent.

Another thing that i see, is that you take a lot of these one-shot spells like Hellbal/ Ruin, those feats unless they are taken on a PM heavy Warrior aren't worth it. In WoG these feats do insane damage in the paper (75d6 for a full caster instead of 25d6 for normal) and stiill people don't take them. Bosses are always going to make their saves unless roll an "Ace" so the damage is pitiful in most times. It is way better again to  raise your main stat. Leave EMA/ ICC and EW, those are really good feats. Let's see, if you drop Hellbal/Ruin/Dragon Knight and leave Dexterity at 14 you will be able to easy raise your INT to 28-30, and now i can see a really scary mage.

Well done for your first build, and again welcome to the ECB.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Your spell penetration (to pierce spell resistance) is based on caster level and can be improved further by the penetration feats.
Your spells DC (how hard it is to save against your spells) is based on your caster stat (intelligence for wizards), and can be improved with the spell focus feats for a given school.
